title: The tragedie of Tancred and Gismund Compiled by the gentlemen of the Inner Temple, and by them presented before her Maiestie. Newly reuiued and polished according to the decorum of these daies. By R.W.
author: R. W. (Robert Wilmot), fl. 1568-1608.
publisher: Printed by Thomas Scarlet, and are to be solde by R. Robinson,
notes: A verse adaptation of "Tancredi and Ghismunda" from: Boccaccio, Giovanni.  Decamerone.

In the original play act 1 was written by Rodger Stafford, act 2 by Henry Noel, act 3 by "G. Al." (possibly William Allen), act 4 by Sir Christopher Hatton, and act 5 by Wilmot. Wilmot revised the play, and probably re-cast it from the original decasyllabic rhyming quatrains into blank verse.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
